page.title: 05HEATON PARK - HISTORY
page.content:
{Heaton Hall}was built in the grounds for Lord and Lady Wilton in 1745.In 1860 Lord Wilton tried to sell Heaton Hall.If this had happened it would have divided Heaton Park in two.The estste had 652 acres and 21 roads.
In 1860 the part of the park opposite St Peters R.C. School was a racecourse and it was a{barracks for the RAF and {Army}before the World War II
Some prefabs were built in 1943 and pulled down in 1965.They were pulled down because the deeds of the park did not allow any buildings.Shop owners in the area protested because of the loss of customers.
